title: Getting Your Instagram URL Using the Website and Mobile App

steps.title: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ and sign in. You can use any web browser to get your profile's URL.

steps.title: Click your profile picture.
steps.content: Click your profile picture. It's in the top right corner of your screen.

steps.title: Copy the link.
steps.content: Copy the link. If you're on Chrome, you can right-click the Profile option and then click Copy link address . If you've already navigated to your profile, you should see your URL in the address bar. You can copy that. For example, the link will show " https://www.instagram.com/YourUsername/ ". Once you have this copied, you can paste it anywhere so others can find your Instagram account.

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon looks like a camera lens on a purple to orange gradient background. Sign in if prompted. Although you can do this on the mobile app, using a web browser is much easier.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the bottom right corner of your screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Note your username.
steps.content: Note your username. You'll see it in the top left corner of your profile page. You'll need to note this so you can create the link.

steps.title: Add your username to the website's name.
steps.content: Add your username to the website's name. In another app, like Google Keep or anywhere that you can take notes, insert your username into " https://www.instagram.com/YourUsername/ ". Once you have this information, you can send your URL to anyone using apps like Messages or Mail .
